Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I have used Redis in front of read-only API requests for insane performance

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: redis can auto-expire data at the interval you choose as well, or "keep it alive" for X seconds after it's been read, things like that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Redis can even talk directly to a postgres DB and render read-only API requests directly, no dynamic language interpreter is run

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: 30ms API responses

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I helped run a short-url company, we did a lot of in-line API stuff to generate HTTP redirects, ultimate performance was necessary

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: When I came on board our hashrate was about 10-15 ms.   Now we hover around 100 within 2 weeks.   James has provided some wonderful avenues for increasing this numbers and the crew has been great to help me produce material along the way.

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content:
We’ve organized a group of 9 international translators @discord-9LhDSask4qpuWa4Syh - and they are working through our list of articles to get as many languages up as possible as well as hitting Regional message boards and chat rooms.   

The Agama wallet traffic from pirate.black is a nice stat to know.   We can pretty much guarantee that these people are downloading for pirate.
